text: Memory space () is a concept related to collective memory, stating that certain places, objects or events can have special significance related to group's remembrance. The concept has been coined by French historian Pierre Nora who defines them as “complex things. At once natural and artificial, simple and ambiguous, concrete and abstract, they are lieux—places, sites, causes—in three senses—material, symbolic and functional”Nora, P. (1997). The realms of memory: Rethinking the French past. New York: Columbia University Press. P. 14 ==References== ==Further reading== * * Category:Memory
